message.content:
You can use the following regular expression (regex) to extract the three-character code from a filename with the given format:
```ruby
^(?P<code>[A-Za-z0-9]{3})\.(?=\b\.usfm\b)\$
```
Explanation:

1. `^` - Matches the start of the string.
2. `(?P<code>[A-Za-z0-9]{3})` - A capturing group that matches exactly three characters, which can be both upper and lowercase letters or digits. `[A-Za-z0-9]` represents any alphanumeric character.
3. `\.` - Matches the literal dot (filename extension).
4. `(?=\b\.usfm\b)` - A positive lookahead to ensure that `.usfm` is followed by a word boundary. This ensures that only the extension ".usfm" is matched and not part of another string.
5. `$` - Matches the end of the string.

This regex will extract the three-character code if it's present at the start of the filename (before the dot) and preceded by ".usfm".
